title: AIME 2

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned}x^3-xyz&=2\\
y^3-xyz&=6\\
z^3-xyz&=20\\\\
\text{Let, }xyz&=t\\
x^3&=(t+2)\hspace{5mm}\color{#3D99F6}\small(1)\\
y^3&=(t+6)\hspace{5mm}\color{#3D99F6}\small(2)\\
z^3&=(t+20)\hspace{3mm}\color{#3D99F6}\small(3)\\\\
\text{Multiplying,}&\color{#3D99F6}(1),(2)\color{#333333}\text{ and }\color{#3D99F6}(3)\\
(xyz)^3&=(t+2)(t+6)(t+20)\\
t^3&=(t+2)(t+6)(t+20)\hspace{5mm}\color{#3D99F6}( t=xyz)\\
t^3&=t^3+28t^2+172t+240\\
0&=28t^2+172t+240 \\
0&=7t^2+43t+60\\
0&=(7t^2+28t)+(15t+60)\\
0&=(7t+15)(t+4)\\
\implies t&=-4,\dfrac{-15}{7}\\\\
\text{Adding,}&\color{#3D99F6}(1),(2)\color{#333333}\text{ and }\color{#3D99F6}(3)\\
x^3+y^3+z^3&=28+3t\\
\text{It is clear that}&\text{ in order to maximize the value of } a^3+b^3+c^3 \text{ we have to maximize } t\\
\implies t&=\dfrac{-15}{7}\\
a^3+b^3+c^3&=28+3\cdot\left(\dfrac{-15}{7}\right)\\
&=\dfrac{196-45}{7}\\
&=\dfrac{151}{7}\\
\implies m+n&=151+7=\color{#EC7300}\boxed{\color{#333333}158}\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Subtracting the first equation from the second:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \displaystyle y^3 - x^3 = 4 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#20A900} \boxed{ \large \displaystyle x = \sqrt[3]{y^3 - 4}  } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Subtracting the second equation from the third:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \displaystyle z^3 - y^3 = 14 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#20A900} \boxed{ \large \displaystyle z = \sqrt[3]{ y^3 + 14}  } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Plugging this two equations into the second:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \displaystyle y^3 - \left [ \sqrt[3]{(y^3 - 4)(y^3 + 14)} \right ] y = 6 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \displaystyle y^3 - 6 = \left [ \sqrt[3]{y^6 + 10y^3 -56} \right ] y "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Cubing both sides:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \displaystyle y^9 - 18y^6 + 108y^3 - 216 = y^3 \left ( y^6 + 10y^3 -56 \right ) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \displaystyle y^9 - 18y^6 + 108y^3 - 216 =  y^9 + 10y^6 -56y^3 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \displaystyle 28y^6 - 164y^3 + 216 = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#20A900} \boxed{ \large \displaystyle 7y^6 - 41y^3 + 54 = 0 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \large \displaystyle y^3 = \frac{41 \pm \sqrt{41^2 - 4\cdot 7 \ 54}}{14} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \displaystyle (i) \ y^3 = \frac{27}{7}  \rightarrow  x^3 = - \frac{1}{7} \rightarrow \large \displaystyle z^3 = - \frac{125}{7}  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Or:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large \displaystyle (ii) \ y^3 = 2 \rightarrow x^3 = -2 \rightarrow z^3 = 16 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (i) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" leads to:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{\large \displaystyle a^3+b^3 + c^3 = \frac{151}{7} } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"While "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (ii) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" leads to:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \boxed{\large \displaystyle a^3+b^3 + c^3 = 16 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the maximum value is:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#20A900} \boxed{\large \displaystyle \frac{151}{7}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\color{#3D99F6} \large \displaystyle m = 151, n = 7, \boxed{\large \displaystyle m + n = 158} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2010 Boxes of Marbles
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Each of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2010"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" boxes in a line contains one red marble, and for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1\\leq k\\leq2010"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the box in the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k^{th}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" position also contains k white marbles. A child begins at the first box and successively draws a single marble at random from each box in order. He stops when he first draws a red marble. Let P(n) be the probability that he stops after drawing exactly n marbles. The possible values(s) of n for which "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(n)<\\frac{1}{2010}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The probability of drawing exactly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" marbles can be calculated as the product of drawing "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" white marbles followed by a red marble:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(n) = \frac{1}{2}\times\frac{2}{3}\times\dots\times\frac{n-1}{n}\times\frac{1}{n+1} = \frac{1}{n(n+1)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solving "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(n) < \frac{1}{2010}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" gives us"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n(n+1) > 2010 \Rightarrow \boxed{n\geq45}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 2010 SMO
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of all the 5-digit positive integers which are not multiples of 11  and whose digits are 1, 3, 4, 7, 9."}]}]}
